Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
technical:
t -> z, z -> z, z -> t
fixed amount ranging from 10, 100, 1000, 10000
on random time

result, anonymous untraceable coins in a public address.
how these public funds in t address are used is up to the user.

This behavior of anonymsing funds in transparent transactions is not possible with other zcash family projects.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: if KMD is equally anonymous to Pirate, then the reason is Jumblr

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: but only when it's usage is more. right now there aren't many doing jumbling

Content: you can obtain the same amount of privacy on any zkSNARKs coin if you're diligent about it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: what jumblr does is make it much harder to make a mistake

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's *very* hard to be diligent about it btw

Author: Alright#0419
Content: pirate makes it impossible to make a mistake ğŸ˜›

Author: sidhujag#3327
Content: The issue you guys found regarding shielded address ip association

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we didnt discover it, zcash team did

Author: sidhujag#3327
Content: I wonder if that has farther reaching consequences because bitcoin recently added a new p2p mechanism to add random timing to hide who did tx and I doubt many of the zcash forks added that yet so you can trace down to who created a tx and where itâ€™s relayed from and to

Author: sidhujag#3327
Content: Oh article says Komodo core dev found

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: crypto journalism

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: accuracy optional

Author: sidhujag#3327
Content: So duke didnâ€™t find it and post on his journal?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: zcash told us and there was a zcash security advisory.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: after that, duke did post on his blog

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as far as correlating transactions, zaddr tx are encrypted, so it is hard to correlate it to any specific zaddr, though it might be possible to use that information to add to an overall database of associations

Author: sidhujag#3327
Content: Yep

Author: sidhujag#3327
Content: Well thereâ€™s a new bio coming down that will help fix that anyway for bitcoin

Author: sidhujag#3327
Content: Bip

Author: sidhujag#3327
Content: Using set sketches removing need for random delay reduce bandwidth by 100x

Author: sidhujag#3327
Content: https://open.library.ubc.ca/cIRcle/collections/ubctheses/24/items/1.0378175

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: erlay is very interesting

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: however it seems to be more about bandwidth efficiency than privacy...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
```Timing attacks from public nodes. Erlayâ€™s design is more robust to timing
attacks from private sybils [18, 29]. Robustness to timing attacks from public
nodes remains an open questions. Both BTCFlood and Erlay use faster relay to
public nodes and slower relay to private nodes. But Erlayâ€™s slower reconciliation
could be abused by public nodes to more easily identify transactions originating
from private nodes. With higher node connectivity this attack becomes expensive,
but a general solution remains as future work.```

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: any attacker would use a public node, so erlay actually reduces privacy. if they are positioning erlay as a privacy enhancement that is not correct
